welcome.data: Warm-up prompt: “What do you already know about text formatting on websites?” Students create an HTML boilerplate and prep for hands-on activity.

aim.data:
State agenda and objective: Learn how to structure and format text using

-

,

, , , and
tags in HTML.

review.data: Review HTML structure from previous lesson (head, body, title). Ask: What does the browser actually show from your file?

relevant.data: Demonstrate the use and meaning of each text-related tag. Discuss semantic vs. stylistic importance with examples.

interactive.data: Students recreate a given layout using text elements. Live code-along with real-time edits and testing in browser.

ownership.data: Students build a personal ‘About Me’ HTML page using all the introduced tags. Must follow structural and semantic rules.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: Students write down two HTML text tags they used today and what each one does.

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, Google Chrome browser, lesson folder `lesson-1-4-html-text`, projector for demonstration.
